Function.Description: The right function returns a specified number of characters from a Text or String argument starting from the rightmost character.

Brief.Overview: The right function returns a specified number of characters from a Text or String argument, beginning at the rightmost character.
Brief.Usage: The right function is used to create a substring of a specified length starting from the rightmost character in a String or Text.

Argument.Name: length
Argument.Note: A positive integer representing the number of characters to return.

Syntax.Return: The substring of length {length} starting from the rightmost character. If length is greater than the length of text, right returns the whole String.
